p.s: The excerpt at hand is of the play Disgraced, Scene 3, written by Ayad Akhtar.
It was published in 2012 and deals with unintentional racism, islamophobia and cultural appropriation.
The given scene is the final part of scene three and is about a clearly escalated dinner between friends and partners, which leads into a racism and vicious motivated act of violence.
The given excerpt of the third scene starts with IsaacsIsaac's try to kiss Emily.
Emily does not do anything against it but just as they are about to kiss, his wife Jory comes in, clearly angry.
She seems shocked and confronts him.
Amir, who had a discussion with Jory before, is inflamed too but does not recognize the situation at first.
Isaac and Emily are trying to explain it by telling them lies.
For Amir it seems to help because he starts to discuss about his job again.
After a short but intense dialogue between Isaac and Amir, Amir spits in IsaacsIsaac's face.
After that, Isaac and Jory are leaving and Emily starts to tell Amir that she had an affair.
In cause of that, Amir loses control and hits Emily multiple times, still he recognizes what he just did and his nephew enters.
